alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 11:28AM EST until March 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River. .Multiple rounds of recent precipitation, preceded by snow melt, will keep minor flooding ongoing along the East Fork White, upper White and most of the Upper Wabash. Lower portions of the White and Wabash are expected to see moderate flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flood water is at critical height for most agricultural levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 22.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Thursday was 22.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning to 15.5 feet. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1030 PM CST /1130 PM EST/.
